paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: transthyretin amyloidosis with cardiac and neuropathic involvement

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 42 with cardiac amyloidosis.

individual_records.phenotype_details: neuropathic symptoms with carpal tunnel syndrome
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 presented with neuropathic symptoms at age 45.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 55.
Patient P4 was diagnosed with severe cardiac involvement at age 68.

functional_data.summary: In vitro studies showed that TTR variants have increased propensity for aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of TTR amyloidosis.
variants.population_frequency: Variant found in 1% of gnomAD population.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family studies and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The TTR-V30M variant is one of the most common mutations associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: Hereditary ATTR amyloidosis is caused by the presence of one of more than 100 known point mutations in the TTR gene.
The most common hereditary form of this disease is transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTR amyloidosis).

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene associated with amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
